metadata.title: CVE-2019-11034 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When processing certain files, PHP EXIF extension in versions 7.1.x below7.1.28, 7.2.x below 7.2.17 and 7.3.x below 7.3.4 can be caused to read pastallocated buffer in exif_process_IFD_TAG function. This may lead toinformation disclosure or crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11034` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2 - 7.2.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
php7.2-bcmath - 7.2.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.17-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
